column2: sure... it's more fun to get BBQ in a little run down place on the side of an old dirt road run by an old man or woman with smoke-stained hands... yes. I agree. Chicago has had a few greats that fit this category too (.. the original Hecky's on Greenbay
column3: Leon's on the south side... Oh Edith! We miss you so!). Smoque is not this. It doesn't have that cinematic
column4: "I've come across something nobody else knows about" thing. They won't cast Wilford Brimley or Bill Cobbs to play the owner in the movie about this place. But really
column5: who cares? For me its about how the food tastes... period. I don't require the foreplay... just fork over the smokey meats please.
